info.name: Book of the Fallen - Custom Rings
info.description: Contains Custom Rings created specifically for the campaign "Book of the Fallen".

description.p:
This ring has a design of a heart dripping blood.
While wearing the ring, your weapon attacks with a Polearm score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

This ring has a design of a heart dripping blood.
While wearing the ring, your Spell Attacks score a critical hit on a roll of 19 or 20.

This pair of purple rings are linked by a magical force. Each ring displays an outstretched hand. One rings hand looks to be casting a spell from a gemstone while the other rings hand levitates a larger gem above it. The former is a Siphoning Ring, and the latter is a Channeling Ring. Only the Channeling Ring can be attuned to.

The ring has a Proficiency Bonus / 2 charges and regains 1d4/2 expended charges daily at dawn. If you're wearing the Channeling Ring while the other ring is being worn by another willing spellcaster on the same place if existence as you, you can use an action to expend 1 of the rings charges to cast a spell from the other creatures known or prepared spells, using no spell slot, but your own spell DC, Spell Attack Bonues and spellcasting ability to do so.

The spell must have a casting time of one action or bonus acton, and must provide any material components required by the spell. If the creature wearing the Siphoning Ring is willing, you are magically aware of its known or prepared spells while wearing the Channeling Ring.
You have access to their spells up to +2 levels above your own maximum.
